doc.field: J.W. Huntting copy of records of the First Church of Christ, Southold, Long Island
J.W. Huntting copy of records of the First Church of Christ, Southold, Long Island
One bound volume containing a handwritten copy of the records of the First Church of Christ in Southold, Long Island, for the period 1694 to 1853. The copy was created by J.W. Huntting in 1858.
One bound volume containing a handwritten copy of the records of the First Church of Christ in Southold, Long Island, for the period 1694 to 1853. The copy was created by J.W. Huntting in 1858.

One bound volume containing a handwritten copy of the records of the First Church of Christ in Southold, Long Island, for the period 1694 to 1853. The volume includes lists of baptisms, communions, covenants, deaths, and marriages, along with references to free and enslaved African Americans. An index of family names covered in the records is also included. The copy was created by J.W. Huntting in 1858.

The First Church of Christ in Southold, Long Island was founded in 1640 as a Presbyterian congregation under the leadership of the Reverend John Younges (Youngs) of Southwold, England. As of 2011, the church continues to serve the Southold community under the name of the First Presbyterian Church of Southold.
The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.
